data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, the directions don’ t work. You follow the instructions for how to take 9 steps left, take 10 steps forward, take 9 steps right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is another word for rewind. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you take 4 steps back to the starting point. If you walk up 4 steps, you walk back down 4 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 4 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take the sequence listed above, turn around, take 5 steps, take 10 steps and turn left again. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first sequence directs you to turn left one step and turn right a step. Taking 7 steps, you are left the same way as you were turned around. To take the next 7 steps to travel to the starting point, you must turn around and turn again one step, taking another 7 steps. If you turned left at the beginning, the first sequence would take you back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can walk the same distance back and forth. Taking one step will equal the amount of time spent walking the entire walk backwards but the previous step can be taken back and forth until it reaches 0 on the measurement. There is only one step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first sequence is essentially a set of instructions that shows you what you will do next. The second sequence leads to that a person will take one step to the right and back and one step to the left and another step to the right. So, for everything, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you get back to the starting point, it is 3 steps. In the first method, you take 3 steps to go back to the start. In the second method, you take 7 steps to go back to the start. In the third method, you take 9 steps to go back to the start. The first method returns you to your original starting point. So, the answer is No.

To take one step backward, you must always face forward. To take three steps forward, you must always face forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you move 1 step backward, you move 2 steps left. When you move 3 steps left, you move 6 steps right. If the instructions indicate that you always take 2 steps left, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let’s think of these instructions as walking down a path with your back to the starting point to walk right back towards the starting point. Taking 6 steps left is to take 3 steps right, 4 steps forward, 9 steps left, 4 steps backward, 10 steps left and 3 steps left. You can see how identifying with these directions makes sense. Taking 6 steps left is like taking 3 steps backward. By facing forward you are not facing backward. So, the answer is No.

One takes 3 steps straight forward, then they will be taken 4 steps left, then take 3 steps right, then a step right. So, the answer is No.

You begin with 1 step forward. You take 3 steps right. After you take 3 steps right, you return to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

Taking 3 steps doesn’t get you to your starting point. Taking 6 steps doesn’t get you to the starting point. Turning around doesn’t get you to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you are facing forward, you always take the same direction of step as you are moving forward from the position you are in right now. So, the answer is yes.

Backward steps can always be taken backward whether you are facing forward or not. The number of step required to move from one place to another (the number backward) is 3. The number of steps reversed must always be taken backward. Thus, the answer is No.

A person can only take one step backwards once. All of the steps come together when you are taking one step forward. A person can only take four steps right once. You can only take six steps left. The answer: No.

Always facing forward, the first step forward is to face right. The first step backward is to face left (first step right). The final step backward is to face left (last step left). There are 4 steps taken in the first 2 sets of instructions. So, the answer is No.

Either you take 5 steps right or take 4 steps backward, and if one of those is the same as taking 4 steps backward, you always return to the square starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

When we walk forward, we always follow the steps until we come to the starting point. We always take 2 steps forward. The first step forward has already been taken, so we will be walking back to where we started. So, the answer is No.
